JobFullDesc: Senior Principal Engineer - Embedded ControllerState-of-the-art products demand state-of-the-art firmware, and that’s the role of our Firmware Engineering team. We lead and deliver the analysis, design, programming, debugging, troubleshooting or modification of software for firmware applications. Our team oversees programming activities involving analog and digital hardware as well as software operating systems. We also influence product development at all stages. In short, we use the latest technology to modify existing solutions, in addition to developing innovative new software and firmware solutionsJoin us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Senior Principal Engineer on our Embedded Controller team in Austin, Tx.What you’ll achieveAs a Senior Principal Engineer with the Embedded Controller team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing firmware on the embedded controller.  You will work with architects, external vendors, partners, ODMs, and other internal groups to deliver best in class solutions.You will:Design and implement firmware on embedded controller (MIPS/ARC/ARM core) processors in a single threaded/interrupt driven and in real time OS environment.Implement solutions using C programming/assembly and conduct design/code reviews.Work on all aspects of software development life cycle (using specifications to assist in design documentation, code development, debugging, validation)Work with system and software architects on feature definitions, requirements, and behavior specifications.Work with both internal groups and external vendors/partners/ODMs, define interface/protocol specifications.Debug complex system software issues using analyzers and other hardware debug toolsCommunicate and coordinate activities across local/remote, internal/external sites.Provide technical advisement and direction to the team and other impacted stakeholdersProvide mentorship and guidance to less experienced developersTake the first step towards your dream careerEvery Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:Essential RequirementsBSEE, BSCE, BSCS or related degree plus 8+ years of current embedded software development experiencePC architecture and windows operating systems, embedded controller development with both single threaded/interrupt driven and real time OS.C programming, Assembly experience, Compilers, assemblers, debuggers.Ability to interpret electrical schematic diagramsFamiliar with latest technology (wireless charging, type C) and various HW bus interface (SMBUS, LPC, I2C, PS2, etc)UEFI BIOS development a plusDesirable RequirementsExperience with Security Development Lifecycle (SDL).
